summary: The Game Launcher is a Windows desktop application used for launching various Games and Utilities; inpired by the Microsoft Vista Games Explorer, but with many improvements.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][color=yellow]Game Launcher[/color][/size]
- By Sir Garnon


[size=4][color=lime][u]Description:[/u][/color][/size]
The Game Launcher is a Windows desktop application used to organize and launch various games and utilities; similar to the Microsoft Vista Games Explorer. However, the Game Launcher provides the gamer with much more control of the individual game settings.

[center]
[img=middle]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/55366-1-1404123961.png[/img][/center]

[size=4][color=lime][u]Launcher Main Features:[/u][/color][/size]
• Friendly user interface; very similar to Microsoft Vista Games Explorer.
• Full control of the game name, genre, command line arguments, box art, etc.
• Support for Steam games.
• Support for DOS games, using DOSBox.
• Ability to combine standard Windows, DOS, and Steam game into a single location.
• Support for drag and drop of Games. If you have an existing game, simply drag the .exe file to the Main Window.
• Custom game Genres for creating you own groups.
• Custom game box art. Basically you can accept the default, or use any image you like.
• Ability to check if Steam is already running.
• Ability to check if the original game disk is required.
• Ability to track which disk is currently in the default CD/DVD drive.
• Support for "Microsoft Age of Empires 2" Windows 7 color glitch. Windows Explorer can be terminated, and then restarted once the game is exited.



[size=4][color=lime][u]Limitation and Known Issues:[/u][/color][/size]
• Please note that this application is only a launcher; it does not come with any games.
• Game Launcher does not come with any game meta data. All information must be manually entered; however it is worth the effort once everything is setup.
• Correct configuration of the game in Game Settings is essential to getting the game to launch correctly.


[size=4][color=lime][u]Requirements:[/u][/color][/size]
• Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8
• [url=http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851]Microsoft .NET Framework v4.0 (Windows XP)[/url]
• [url=http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30653]Microsoft .NET Framework v4.5 (Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8)[/url]
• If you have older DOS based games, [url=http://www.dosbox.com/]DOSBox[/url] must be installed.

[size=4][color=lime][u]Installation:[/u][/color][/size]
• Just unzip the download file anywhere you like, then run GameLauncher.exe file.
• The first time Game Launcher is started, a popup window will ask for the path to the config file; for new users, simply click the "New..." button:

[center]
[img=middle]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/images/110/470953-1404123217.png[/img][/center]


If you find this utility useful, please feel free to Endorse it.

[size=4][color=lime][u]Other Mods by me:[/u][/color][/size]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6491]Skyrim Performance Monitor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/3826]Skyrim Performance Monitor 64[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1762]Fallout Performance Monitor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/44763/]Ini File Editor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/52402]ArchiveInvalidation File Generator[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30745]Skyrim DDS Image Viewer[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22069]Fallout 4 DDS Image Viewer[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44397]Nexus Mod Monitor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55366]Game Launcher[/url]

Enjoy!
author: Sir Garnon
